column4: I have a rather obscure problem dealing with burning cd's ( http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=1467227#post1467227 ) ive had it for a couple of months and havent been able to find a solution for it on google or the forums and havent recieved a response on the forums, so ive decided to give it a shot here.
no
everything
well... i tried cdrecord from command lin e
nautilus
k3b
gnomebaker
read the post
it has more details
and id rather not flood the server
paste the url of the post again, please
unfortunately, that's a firmware bug
debian just announced that they were going to switch cd record programs, because ...
while the author of cdrecord is very good, he often says "bad firmware" or "kernel bug" instead of working around the problem
he's right that it's a firmware problem, but just saying to people "buy another drive" isn't helpful
oh, yes, definitely
try searching the archives of the cdrecord mailing list
there are so many types of cd burners, nobody can remember the details of all of them.  At least, I can't.
because burn-free happens entirely within the drive under the control of the firmware
one thing that might help is to turn on scsi emulation for the burner and try it again
since kernel 2.6, scsi emulation is no longer required for an ide burner, but it can still be used.
nothing to lose by trying, except a cd blank.
odds are it will still fail, but blanks are cheap  :)
